moving_superSlow.title: moving_superSlow
moving_superSlow.explanation:
Object decelerates very gently after starting from a moving state.

IDEAL FOR
Bottom Sheet

moving_verySlow.title: moving_verySlow
moving_verySlow.explanation:
Object decelerates gentlyafter starting from a moving state.

IDEAL FOR
Toast

moving_slow.title: moving_verySlow
moving_slow.explanation: Object decelerates normally after starting from a moving state.

slow_superSlow.title: slow_superSlow
slow_superSlow.explanation:
Object decelerates very gently after accelerating normally from its initial position.

IDEAL FOR
List Expand

slow_verySlow.title: slow_verySlow
slow_verySlow.explanation:
Object decelerates gently after accelerating normally from its initial position.

IDEAL FOR
Page TransitionCard Scroll

slow_slow.title: slow_slow
slow_slow.explanation: Object decelerates normally after accelerating normally from its initial position.

slow_moving.title: slow_moving
slow_moving.explanation: Object accelerates normally and ends up in a moving state.

verySlow_slow.title: verySlow_slow
verySlow_slow.explanation:
Object decelerates normally after accelerating gently from its initial position.

IDEAL FOR
Bottom Sheet

verySlow_moving.title: verySlow_moving
verySlow_moving.explanation: Object accelerates gently and ends up in a moving state.

superSlow_slow.title: superSlow_slow
superSlow_slow.explanation: Object decelerates normally after accelerating very gently from its initial position.

superSlow_moving.title: superSlow_moving
superSlow_moving.explanation:
Object accelerates very gently and ends up in a moving state.

IDEAL FOR
Bottom Sheet

linear.title: linear
linear.explanation:
Object moves at a constant speed form start to finish with no acceleration or deceleration.

IDEAL FOR
Shimmer

elastic.title: elastic
elastic.explanation:
The object moves past its final position (overshoot) and then smoothly return to settle into place (relax). This motion is ideal for interactive elements that benefit from a dynamic and playful feel.

IDEAL FOR
Pop-Up

bounce.title: bounce
bounce.explanation:
The object moves to its final position (Action) at a constant speed and then reflects back with the same speed gently decelerating to its initial position (Reflection). The duration for reflection should be approximately 2.5x that of action. This motion is ideal for interactive elements that require instant and eye-catching visual feedback, such as button taps or clicks.

IDEAL FOR
Button Tap
